title: Lorna — Magic meeting intelligence
content:
1. Introduction

This policy applies to:

  • Use of our online meeting recording and transcription tools, websites, and web applications.
  • Interactions via third-party integrations, such as Microsoft Teams, Google Calendar, Slack, and Zoom.
  • Communications with our support team, participation in surveys, and feedback submissions.

This policy applies where we act as a Data Controller with respect to the personal data of users of our Services; that is, where we determine the purposes and means of processing that personal data. For content you upload or share through our Services ("User Content"), you are responsible for ensuring compliance with privacy laws and securing all necessary consents from meeting participants and other relevant parties.

By accessing or using our Services, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

2. Data Collection

We collect and process personal data necessary to deliver and improve our Services. The types of data we collect include:

a. Profile and Contact Information

  • Examples: Name, email address, job title, company name, and profile image URL.
  • Collection: Provided during registration, account updates, or when using third-party authentication services like Google Sign-In or Microsoft Sign-In. We will fetch and store your email address, name, and profile image URL from these services.
  • Legal Basis: Performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)) and our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)) in providing and improving the Services.

b. Communication Data

  • Examples: Meeting recordings, transcripts, meeting topics, calendar event details, and participant information.
  • Usage: Necessary for providing transcription, analytics, and meeting summaries.
  • Collection: When you use our Services to record meetings, we collect and process the audio and video recordings and generate transcripts.

  • Google API Compliance: Our use and transfer of data obtained via Google APIs adheres to the Google API Services User Data Policy, including Limited Use requirements.

    We do not use data obtained through Google Workspace APIs to develop, improve, or train generalized AI and/or machine learning models.

  • Legal Basis: Performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)).
  • User Responsibility: When using our Services to record meetings, you are responsible for informing all participants that the meeting is being recorded and obtaining any necessary consents required by law.

c. Device and IP Data

  • Examples: IP address, device type, operating system, browser type and version, and unique identifiers.
  • Usage: For security, troubleshooting, and optimization of Services.
  • Collection: Automatically collected when you interact with our Services.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)) in maintaining the security and performance of our Services.

d. Analytics and Usage Data

  • Examples: Page visits, session durations, clicks, and referral URLs.
  • Usage: Improving functionality and user experience, analyzing the use of the website and services, monitoring and improving our Services, preventing abuse, and assisting users with support inquiries.
  • Collection: Automatically collected through our analytics tracking systems.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

e. Payment Information

  • Examples: Card type, last four digits of the card, billing address, and transaction data.
  • Usage: Processed securely for subscription billing and renewals via our payment processors.
  • Legal Basis: Performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)) and compliance with legal obligations (GDPR Art. 6(1)(c)).

f. Customer Support Data

  • Examples: Content of support tickets, emails, or other inquiries.
  • Usage: To resolve issues, provide feedback, and improve our Services.
  • Legal Basis: Performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)) and our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

g. Cookies and Tracking Technologies

  • Examples: Session cookies, performance cookies, and functional cookies.
  • Usage: Enhance website functionality, maintain user preferences, and analyze traffic.
  • Collection: Through cookies and similar technologies when you use our Services.
  • Legal Basis: Consent (GDPR Art. 6(1)(a)).

h. Location Information

  • Examples: Approximate location inferred from IP address or business address.
  • Usage: To customize the Services and for security purposes.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

i. Technical Log Data

  • Examples: Server logs that may include IP addresses, browser type, operating system, referral source, and other technical information.
  • Usage: Ensuring the proper administration of our website and business, analyzing the use of the website and services, monitoring and improving our Services.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

j. Product Analytics Data

  • Examples: User interactions with our Services, such as features used, pages visited, and other usage metrics.
  • Usage: To improve our Services and develop new features.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

k. Marketing Communication

  • Examples: Email newsletters, promotional content, and information about our products and services.
  • Usage: To communicate with you about our Services and promotions.
  • Legal Basis: Consent (GDPR Art. 6(1)(a)).

You can opt out of marketing communications at any time by contacting us at privacy@lorna.ai.

l. Service and Transactional Notifications

  • Examples: Emails about your account, service changes, or new policies.
  • Usage: Necessary information for the Services.
  • Legal Basis: Performance of a contract (GDPR Art. 6(1)(b)) and our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

You cannot opt out of these "service or transactional" emails unless you delete your account.

m. Correspondence Information

  • Examples: Information you provide if you participate in a focus group, research interview, contest, activity or event, or interact with our social media accounts.
  • Usage: Communicating with you and record-keeping.
  • Legal Basis: Our legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)).

3. How We Use Personal Data

We use the collected data for various purposes, including:

  • Service Provision and Maintenance: Providing meeting recording, transcription, and analytics. Integrating with external services like Microsoft Teams, Google Calendar, Slack, and Zoom. Alerting participants when meetings are being recorded.
  • Enhancement and Development: Using anonymized data to improve algorithms and features like sentiment analysis or actionable insights. Analyzing usage patterns to improve user experience.
  • Marketing and Engagement: Sending relevant updates, newsletters, and promotional content (with your consent).
  • Security and Compliance: Detecting fraud, preventing unauthorized access, and ensuring regulatory compliance. Complying with legal obligations.
  • Customer Support: Resolving issues and processing feedback for service improvement. Communicating with you regarding support inquiries.

4. Data Retention

We retain personal data only as long as necessary for:

  • Delivering Services.
  • Complying with legal and regulatory requirements.
  • Resolving disputes or enforcing our agreements.

In some cases, we may retain personal data longer if required by law or necessary to protect our legal rights.

5. Data Sharing and Transfers

We may share your personal data under the following circumstances:

a. Service Providers

Categories: Hosting and Infrastructure Providers, Payment Processors, Analytics and Performance Monitoring Tools, Customer Support Platforms, Marketing and Email Service Providers, Internal Communication Tools.

Purpose: To support core functions of our Services. We ensure that all service providers adhere to data protection standards and have appropriate agreements in place.

We will not sell your personal data to third parties.

b. Legal Obligations

We may disclose your information when required by law, such as to comply with a subpoena, court order, or other legal processes.

c. Business Transactions

In the event of a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, reorganization, or sale of assets, your information may be transferred as part of the transaction. We will notify you in advance and give you the option to delete your data before the transfer.

d. With Your Consent

We may share your data with third parties when you explicitly authorize us to do so.

International Data Transfers

We primarily store and process personal data in Microsoft Azure’s data centers located in the European Economic Area (EEA), specifically in Ireland. For functionalities involving artificial intelligence or global access, limited data may be transferred outside the EEA, protected by:

  • Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs): We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place for international data transfers.
  • Robust Encryption and Access Controls: Data is encrypted during transfer, and access is restricted to authorized personnel.

By using our Services, you consent to these transfers.

6. Your Rights

Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable laws, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

  • Access: Request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
  • Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data.
  • Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten"): Request deletion of your data.
  • Restriction: Limit how your data is processed.
  • Data Portability: Receive your data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
  • Objection: Object to certain processing activities, such as direct marketing.
  • Withdraw Consent: Revoke consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of prior processing.

To exercise your rights or if you have any questions regarding our processing of your personal data, please contact us at privacy@lorna.ai.

If you believe that our processing of your personal data infringes data protection laws, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. As a European company, Lorna AI uses the Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information as our lead supervisory authority. You may also contact your national or state supervisory authority.

7. Security Measures

We implement robust measures to secure personal data:

  • Encryption: All connections to Lorna AI are encrypted using SSL/TLS protocols. Data is encrypted both in transit and at rest.
  • Access Controls: Access to personal data is restricted to authorized personnel who require it for their job responsibilities and are subject to confidentiality obligations.
  • Secure Hosting: We host our software on Microsoft Azure. Azure data centers adhere to strict security standards, including ISO 27001 and SOC certifications.
  • Network Security: Our databases are located in virtual private networks with strict security groups. Only necessary communication to and between servers is allowed.

We have procedures in place to deal with any suspected data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach where we are legally required to do so.

8. Cookies and Tracking

We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to enhance your experience and analyze usage:

Type

  • Essential Cookies: Enable core features like authentication and security.
  • Functional Cookies: Store user preferences (e.g., language settings).
  • Performance Cookies: Analyze usage to improve website functionality.

You can manage cookies through your browser settings. Not accepting cookies may make certain features of the Services unavailable to you. By using our Services, you agree to our use of cookies as described in this policy.

9. Children's Privacy

Our Services are not intended for individuals under the age of:

  • 13: In the United States.
  • 16: In the European Union (or as required by applicable laws).

We do not knowingly collect or process personal data from children under these ages, and no part of our Services is directed to them. If we discover we have collected data from a minor without parental consent, we will delete it promptly. Parents or guardians can contact us at privacy@lorna.ai for assistance.

10. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. If a change is material, we will notify you before it takes effect by:

  • Posting a notice on our website.
  • Sending you an email notification.

By continuing to use our Services after those changes become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with the changes, you should discontinue use of the Services and delete your account.

11. Company Acquisition

In the event that we are involved in a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, reorganization, or sale of assets, your information may be transferred as part of that transaction. We will notify you in advance and give you the option to delete your data before the transfer.

12. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, or if you wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:

Lorna AI SRL
Address: Turda 94, 1st District, Bucharest
Email: privacy@lorna.ai
